summary: Diff adds a full single-page artisan-themed landing page with hero, curated hampers, explainer, lead form, values, testimonials, FAQ, final CTA, and footer. It also adds a Motoko backend method to submit and query leads plus analytics/scroll utilities. Key gaps are backend persistence/confirmation fields and some missing section IDs required for analytics-friendly scrolling.

missing_requirements.requirement: Persist lead submissions in stable storage so they survive canister upgrades.
missing_requirements.reason: Backend stores leads in an in-memory `var leads = Array.empty<HamperLead>()` with no `stable var` or explicit upgrade hooks/migration shown.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend update method must return an ID and timestamp (or equivalent confirmation fields) for each inquiry submission.
missing_requirements.reason: `submitHamperLead` returns `async ()` and only appends the lead; no ID/timestamp is generated or returned.

missing_requirements.requirement: Each major section has a stable DOM id (e.g., #curated, #customize, #testimonials, #faq) for CTA scrolling and analytics-friendly structure.
missing_requirements.reason: Only some sections show explicit ids (`id="curated"`, `id="customize"`, `id="faq"`). Other major sections in the page (e.g., testimonials, values/story, explainer, final CTA) do not show ids in the provided diff.

hallucinated_features.description: Added an authorization/user-profile system and admin-token initialization flow unrelated to a marketing landing page lead capture backend.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only asks for a minimal endpoint to store/retrieve lead submissions; diff adds AccessControl/MixinAuthorization, user profile CRUD, and admin token initialization via URL parameter.
